Package com.rb.nonbiz.types

Class RationalUnitFraction

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Number
com.rb.nonbiz.types.RBNumeric<T>
com.rb.nonbiz.types.PreciseValue<RationalUnitFraction>
com.rb.nonbiz.types.RationalUnitFraction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<RationalUnitFraction>
public class RationalUnitFraction
extends PreciseValue<RationalUnitFraction>
Represents fractions with values between 0 and 1, inclusive, by storing both the numerator and denominator as integers.

Like UnitFraction, except that:

  1. this is in Q (both numerator and denominator are integers)
  2. beyond just storing a single value of numerator / denominator, this actually remembers the numerator and denominator.

It's better to use this in cases where we want to represent some portion of a population e.g. we traded on k out m days.

See Also:
UnitFraction, Serialized Form
